data.sentence: The word مِنْ comes from the root م ن and is associated with the meanings: From

data.meanings: Becoming distant, remote, far off, aloof or far awayRemoved, retired, withdrew to a distanceAlienated, estranged, wide separation, great distancePossessing judgment and prudence, penetrating, effective judgment, depth or far reaching judgmentGo or going a great length or far in hostility.
data.sentence: The word بَعِيدٍ comes from the root ب ع د and is associated with the meanings: Becoming distant, remote, far off, aloof or far awayRemoved, retired, withdrew to a distanceAlienated, estranged, wide separation, great distancePossessing judgment and prudence, penetrating, effective judgment, depth or far reaching judgmentGo or going a great length or far in hostility.
The word سَمِعُوا comes from the root س م ع and is associated with the meanings: to hear, hearken, listen.

data.meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.
data.sentence: The word مَكَانٍ comes from the root ك و ن and is associated with the meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.

data.meanings: to see/think/hold, in opinion of, perceive, judge, consider, know. ara'itaka / ara'itakum - do tell me thou/you (the personal pronoun Kaf is added for emphasis and is not purely as pleonism without adding to the meaning). tara'ni is for a compound word of a verb tara followed by a pronoun ni - you see me. badi al-ra'yi - having superficial view, outward appearance, first thought, apparently, without proper consideration. ra'yal'ain - to see with naked eye, judgement by sight. ri'yun - outward appearance, make a show. ru'ya - vision dream. a'lam tara - behold! lo! ri'aun - hypocrisy, ostentation, to be seen. tara'a - to see one another, consider, come in sight of one another. yura'una - they deceive hypocritically assuming a false appearance.
data.sentence: The word رَأَتْهُمْ comes from the root ر ا ي and is associated with the meanings: to see/think/hold, in opinion of, perceive, judge, consider, know. ara'itaka / ara'itakum - do tell me thou/you (the personal pronoun Kaf is added for emphasis and is not purely as pleonism without adding to the meaning). tara'ni is for a compound word of a verb tara followed by a pronoun ni - you see me. badi al-ra'yi - having superficial view, outward appearance, first thought, apparently, without proper consideration. ra'yal'ain - to see with naked eye, judgement by sight. ri'yun - outward appearance, make a show. ru'ya - vision dream. a'lam tara - behold! lo! ri'aun - hypocrisy, ostentation, to be seen. tara'a - to see one another, consider, come in sight of one another. yura'una - they deceive hypocritically assuming a false appearance.

data.meanings: anger, wrath, rage, vehemence, distress; cooking-pot
data.sentence: The word تَغَيُّظًا comes from the root غ ي ظ and is associated with the meanings: anger, wrath, rage, vehemence, distress; cooking-pot

data.meanings: a sigh/sob, draw in breath due to distress, to groan, moan in grief, a sea that makes a roaring, one who carries loads/burdens, calamity/misfortune.
data.sentence: The word وَزَفِيرًا comes from the root ز ف ر and is associated with the meanings: a sigh/sob, draw in breath due to distress, to groan, moan in grief, a sea that makes a roaring, one who carries loads/burdens, calamity/misfortune.
